order: Sequence Read Archive for AIRR NCBI

propertyLabels.Sequence Read Archive for AIRR NCBI: Sequence Read Archive for AIRR NCBI

propertyDescriptions.Submissions Release Date: The date upon which all the submissions in this metadata form will be made publicly visible by NCBI. If this field is empty, submissions will be released immediately. (Note that release of an SRA submission also forces the release of referenced BioSample submission entries, and in turn release of the referenced BioProject.)
propertyDescriptions.BioProject for AIRR NCBI: Project description based on AIRR NCBI BioProject

order: Prior Therapies for Primary Disease under Study
Number of Cells per Sequencing Reaction

propertyLabels.Subject: Subject
propertyLabels.Prior Therapies for Primary Disease unde: Prior Therapies for Primary Disease under Study
propertyLabels.Number of Cells per Sequencing Reaction: Number of Cells per Sequencing Reaction

propertyDescriptions.Age: Absolute age of subject at time of 'Age Event'. If available, provide the age with the abbreviated SI unit (Examples: '65 a' = 65 annum (years), '23 w' = 23 weeks, '15 d' = 15 days)
propertyDescriptions.Biomaterial Provider: Name and address of the entity providing the sample (Example: 'Tissues-R-Us, Tampa, FL, USA')
propertyDescriptions.Cell Quality: Relative amount of viable cells after preparation and (if applicable) thawing (Example: '90% viability as determined by 7-AAD')
propertyDescriptions.Age Event: Event in the study schedule to which 'Age' refers. For NCBI BioSample this MUST be 'sampling'. For other implementations submitters need to be aware that there is currently no mechanism to encode to potential delta between 'Age event' and 'Sample collection time', hence the chosen events should be in temporal proximity. (Example: 'sampling', 'enrollment') Use 'missing', 'not applicable', or 'not available' if needed.
propertyDescriptions.Cell Subset: Commonly-used designation of isolated cell population (Example: 'Class Switched Memory B Cells')
propertyDescriptions.Cell Isolation: Description of the procedure used for marker-based isolation or enrich cells (Example: 'Cells were stained with fluorochrome labeled antibodies and then sorted on a FlowMerlin (CE) cytometer')
propertyDescriptions.Ethnicity: Ethnic group of subject (defined as cultural/language-based membership) (Example: 'English, Kurds, Manchu, Yakuts' (and other fields from Wikipedia))
propertyDescriptions.Length of Disease: Time duration between initial diagnosis and current intervention (Example: '23 months')
propertyDescriptions.Tissue: The actual tissue sampled, e.g. lymph node, liver, peripheral blood (Example: 'Bone marrow')
propertyDescriptions.Tissue Processing: Enzymatic digestion and/or physical methods used to isolate cells from sample (Example: 'Collagenase A/Dnase I digested, followed by Percoll gradient')
propertyDescriptions.Sample Type: The way the sample was obtained, e.g. fine-needle aspirate, organ harvest, peripheral venous puncture (Example: 'Biopsy')
propertyDescriptions.Other Relevant Medical History: Medical history of subject that is relevant to assess the course of disease and/or treatment (Example: 'MGUS, first diagnosed 5 years prior')
propertyDescriptions.Organism: Binomial designation of experimental subject's species (Example: 'Homo sapiens')
propertyDescriptions.Anatomic Site: The anatomic location of the tissue, e.g. Inguinal, femur (Example: 'Iliac crest')
propertyDescriptions.Race: Racial group of subject (as defined by NIH) (Examples: 'White', 'American Indian or Alaska Native', 'Black', 'Asian', 'Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander', 'Other')
propertyDescriptions.Subject: Metadata about the individual being studied
propertyDescriptions.Prior Therapies for Primary Disease unde: List of all relevant previous therapies applied to subject for treatment of `Diagnosis` (Example: 'melphalan/prednisone')
propertyDescriptions.Intervention Definition: Description of intervention (Example: 'systemic chemotherapy, 6 cycles, 1.25 mg/m2')
propertyDescriptions.Ancestry Population: Broad geographic origin of ancestry (continent) (Example: list of continents, 'mixed', or 'unknown')
propertyDescriptions.Study Group Description: Designation of study arm to which the subject is assigned to (Example: 'control')
propertyDescriptions.Cell Subset Phenotype: List of cellular markers and their expression levels used to isolate the cell population (Example: 'CD19+ CD38+ CD27+ IgM- IgD-')
propertyDescriptions.Immunogen: Antigen, vaccine or drug applied to subject at this intervention (Example: 'bortezomib')
propertyDescriptions.Processing Protocol: Description of the methods applied to the sample including cell preparation/ isolation/enrichment and nucleic acid extraction. This should closely mirror the Materials and methods section in the manuscript (Example: 'Stimulated wih anti-CD3/anti-CD28')
propertyDescriptions.Synthetic Library: TRUE for libraries in which the diversity has been synthetically generated (for example, phage display) (Example: 'FALSE')
propertyDescriptions.Relation Type: Relation between subject and linked subjects (through 'Related Subjects' field); can be genetic or environmental (for example, exposure) (Examples: 'father', 'daughter', 'household', 'donor')
propertyDescriptions.Disease State of Sample: Histopathologic evaluation of the sample (Example: 'Tumor infiltration')
propertyDescriptions.Number of Cells per Sequencing Reaction: Number of cells for each biological replicate (Example: '50000')
propertyDescriptions.Number of Cells in Experiment: Total number of cells that went into the experiment (Example: '1000000')
propertyDescriptions.Sample Collection Time: Time point at which sample was taken, relative to `Collection time event` (Example: '14 d')
propertyDescriptions.Single-cell Sort: TRUE if single cells were isolated into separate compartments (Example: 'FALSE')
propertyDescriptions.Cell Storage: TRUE if cells were cryo-preserved between isolation and further processing (Example: 'TRUE')
propertyDescriptions.Optional BioSample Attribute: Enter the name of the optional attribute, followed by the value of that attribute. Add additional attributes as needed.
propertyDescriptions.Estimated Release Date: Advisory only. The actual release date used by NCBI is set by the template's Submissions Release Date field.
propertyDescriptions.Strain Name: Non-human: designation of the strain or breed of animal used (Example: 'C57BL/6J')
propertyDescriptions.Disease Stage: Stage of disease at current intervention (Example: 'Stage II')
propertyDescriptions.Sample ID: Sample ID assigned by submitter, unique within study ('sample name' in NCBI) (Example: 'SUP52415')
propertyDescriptions.Subject ID: Submitter-assigned identifier for a subject in a study, unique within study (encoded as 'isolate' in NCBI) (Example: 'SUB856413')
propertyDescriptions.Collection Time Event: Event in the study schedule to which `Sample collection time` relates to (Example: 'Primary vaccination')
propertyDescriptions.Relation to Other Subjects: Subject IDs to which `Relation Type` refers (Example: 'SUB1355648')

items.schema:name: BioSample for AIRR NCBI

items.title: Sequence Read Archive for AIRR NCBI field schema
items.description: Sequence Read Archive for AIRR NCBI field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 1.9.0

propertyDescriptions.Read Lengths: Read length in bases for each direction (Example: '[300,300]')
propertyDescriptions.Template Amount: Amount of template that went into the process (Example: '1000 ng')
propertyDescriptions.Target Locus for PCR: Designation of the target locus according to standard gene nomenclature (Example: 'IGH')
propertyDescriptions.Sequencing Platform: Designation of sequencing instrument used (Example: 'Alumina LoSeq 1000')
propertyDescriptions.Sequencing Facility: Name (company, core facility, and/or lab name) and address of sequencing facility (Example: 'Seqs-R-Us, Vancouver, BC, Canada')
propertyDescriptions.Library Strategy: Sequencing strategy used in the experiment (Example: 'RNA-Seq')
propertyDescriptions.Library Source: Type of genetic source material sequenced in the experiment (Example: 'Metagenomic')
propertyDescriptions.Library Selection: Method of selection or enrichment used in the Experiment (Example: 'RANDOM-PCR')
propertyDescriptions.Library Generation Protocol: Description of processes applied to substrate to obtain a library that is ready for sequencing (Example: 'cDNA was generated using...'; include DNA quality control method, library generation method (RACE or oligo (nested) amplification based), enzymes, cycles, etc.; RNA: amplification of polyA or other (define) to generate cDNA (specify the the technology for RT reaction); description of how barcodes and primers are organized (short description about the general set-up of the amplicon generation, cellular and sample barcode layout (if applicable), including a mapping between samples and barcodes); unique molecular identifier (UMI or UID), describing set-up of molecular identifiers, if they are used); sequence of the Forward PCR Primer Sequences; sequence of the Reverse PCR Primer Sequences; define PhiX, calibrators, and internal controls, if used.) May reference external documents, if persistent and openly available.
propertyDescriptions.Target Substrate Quality: Description and results of the quality control performed on the template material (Example: 'RIN 9.2')
propertyDescriptions.Forward PCR Primer Target Location: Position of the most distal nucleotide templated by the forward primer or primer mix (Example: 'IGHV, +23')
propertyDescriptions.Reverse PCR Primer Target Location: Position of the most proximal nucleotide templated by the reverse primer or primer mix (Example: 'IGHG, +57')
propertyDescriptions.Batch Number: ID of sequencing run assigned by the sequencing facility (Example: '160101_M01234_0201_000000000-D2T7V')
propertyDescriptions.Total Reads Passing QC Filter: Number of usable reads for analysis (Example: '10365118')
propertyDescriptions.Sequencing Kit: Name, manufacturer, order and lot numbers of sequencing kit (Example: 'FullSeq 600, Alumina, #M123456C0, 789G1HK')
propertyDescriptions.filename: Enter the name of the raw data file into the Value field of each attribute-value pair. Each name must match the name of a file selected for upload. (The attributes are automatically named as 'filename1', 'filename2', etc..)
propertyDescriptions.File Type: Type of the raw data file. Must be one of the acceptable file types, including bam, sra, kar, srf, sff, fastq, tab, 454_native, Helicos_native, SOLiD_native_csfasta, SOLiD_native_qual, SOLiD_native, PacBio_HDF5, CompleteGenomics_native, bam_header, reference_fasta. For multiple files of different types, enter one File Type per file, separated by commas.
propertyDescriptions.Target Substrate: The class of nucleic acid that was used as primary starting material for the following procedures (Example: 'RNA'
propertyDescriptions.Protocol IDs: When using a library generation protocol from a commercial provider, provide the protocol version number (Example: 'v2.1 (2016-09-15)')
propertyDescriptions.Complete Sequences: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V segment codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J segment (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. (Example: 'partial')
propertyDescriptions.Physical Linkage of Different Loci: Describes the mode of linkage if a method was used which physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct loci in a single-cell context (Example: 'hetero_head-head')
propertyDescriptions.Sample ID: Sample ID assigned by submitter, unique within study ('sample name' in NCBI). This needs to match the Sample ID in the corresponding BioSample entry. (Example: 'SUP52415')
propertyDescriptions.Nucleic Acid Processing ID: Maps to NCBI Library ID: Each experiment should have a unique Library_ID that is short and meaningful (like an ID you might use in lab). Each SRA entry represents a unique combination of sample + library + sequencing strategy + layout + instrument model. (Example: 'LIB52415')
propertyDescriptions.Library Layout: Number, order, orientation, and distance of associated reads (Example: '2 Kbp paired ends')

Read Lengths.schema:description: Read length in bases for each direction (Example: '[300,300]')
Read Lengths.schema:name: Read Lengths
Read Lengths.description: Read Lengths field schema autogenerated by the CEDAR Template Editor 1.4.3-SNAPSHOT

File Type.title: File Type field schema
File Type.description: File Type field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 1.6.4-SNAPSHOT
File Type.schema:name: File Type
File Type.schema:description: Type of the raw data file. Must be one of the acceptable file types, including bam, sra, kar, srf, sff, fastq, tab, 454_native, Helicos_native, SOLiD_native_csfasta, SOLiD_native_qual, SOLiD_native, PacBio_HDF5, CompleteGenomics_native, bam_header, reference_fasta. For multiple files of different types, enter one File Type per file, separated by commas.

Sequencing Facility.title: Sequencing facility field schema

Library Generation Protocol.schema:description: Description of processes applied to substrate to obtain a library that is ready for sequencing (Example: 'cDNA was generated using...'; include DNA quality control method, library generation method (RACE or oligo (nested) amplification based), enzymes, cycles, etc.; RNA: amplification of polyA or other (define) to generate cDNA (specify the the technology for RT reaction); description of how barcodes and primers are organized (short description about the general set-up of the amplicon generation, cellular and sample barcode layout (if applicable), including a mapping between samples and barcodes); unique molecular identifier (UMI or UID), describing set-up of molecular identifiers, if they are used); sequence of the Forward PCR Primer Sequences; sequence of the Reverse PCR Primer Sequences; define PhiX, calibrators, and internal controls, if used.) May reference external documents, if persistent and openly available.
Library Generation Protocol.schema:name: Library Generation Protocol
Library Generation Protocol.description: Library generation protocol field schema autogenerated by the CEDAR Template Editor
Library Generation Protocol.title: Library generation protocol field schema

Complete Sequences.title: Complete Sequences field schema
Complete Sequences.description: Complete Sequences field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 1.8.0
Complete Sequences.schema:name: Complete Sequences
Complete Sequences.schema:description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V segment codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J segment (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. (Example: 'partial')

Physical Linkage of Different Loci.title: Physical Linkage of Different Loci field schema
Physical Linkage of Different Loci.description: Physical Linkage of Different Loci field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 1.8.0
Physical Linkage of Different Loci.schema:name: Physical Linkage of Different Loci
Physical Linkage of Different Loci.schema:description: Describes the mode of linkage if a method was used which physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct loci in a single-cell context (Example: 'hetero_head-head')

Sample ID.title: Sample ID field schema
Sample ID.description: Sample ID field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 1.8.1
Sample ID.schema:name: Sample ID
Sample ID.schema:description: Sample ID assigned by submitter, unique within study ('sample name' in NCBI). This needs to match the Sample ID in the corresponding BioSample entry. (Example: 'SUP52415')

Nucleic Acid Processing ID.title: Nucleic Acid Processing ID field schema
Nucleic Acid Processing ID.description: Nucleic Acid Processing ID field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 1.8.1
Nucleic Acid Processing ID.schema:name: Nucleic Acid Processing ID
Nucleic Acid Processing ID.schema:description: Maps to NCBI Library ID: Each experiment should have a unique Library_ID that is short and meaningful (like an ID you might use in lab). Each SRA entry represents a unique combination of sample + library + sequencing strategy + layout + instrument model. (Example: 'LIB52415')

Library Layout.schema:description: Number, order, orientation, and distance of associated reads (Example: '2 Kbp paired ends')
